p: Results: A total of 359 patients were enrolled with mean age of 55.1 ± 10.2 years. Both groups were matched regarding the age, gender, body mass index, the association of diabetes or hypertension, and Euro score. AKI group had significantly higher mortality 6 % vs group I 1.7 % (p = 0.026). The hsTnT significant changes between both groups remain all over the course, which unparalleled to those of CK-MB. The AKI group with more associated with heart failure 17.9 % vs 4.9 % (p = .000); and post-operative atrial fibrillation, 12.4 % vs 2.9 % (p = 0.005). Lengths of ventilation, stays in ICU and in hospital were significantly higher in the AKI group.
